result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).   Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be paid by the end of Extended Supervision period.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

Reception at Dodge Correctional Facility.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Reception at Dodge Correctional Facility.  
--Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program effective immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment, full time school or combination of both.
No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
Obtain an AODA assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

superTimeConds.notes: During the period of Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and body armor possession and voting

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in box at 9:07am.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of  to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Steve Paull and Michael Koch who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 2:17pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter is set for sentencing on February 4, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury back in box at 2:00pm.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Molina, DNA Analyst Patricia Dobrowski, MPD Forensic Investigator Jason Reifschneider and MPD Forensic Investigator David Wagoner.  Exhibits #2, #3, #4, #10, #11 and #20, received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Sworn for defense:  Dinah W.  The Court have a colloquy with the Defendant who elected not to testify.  Defense rests.   Sworn for state as rebuttal witness:  MPD Detective Angela Juarez.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 4:00pm.  Matter is adjourned to January 21, 2016 at 8:30am for continued jury trial.  
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Conway, Milwaukee Police Officer Scott Kaiser and Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Molina.  Jury out of box at 12:00 noon.  Matter adjourned to 1:30pm on January 20, 2016.

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury panel in court at 2:13pm.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded. Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Chris Conway.  Exhibits #7, #9, #13, #14, #18, and #19 received.

Matter is adjourned to January 20, 2016 at 9:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for continued jury trial.

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire started at the hour of 10:30am.  Panel dismissed at 11:50am and ordered to return at 1:30pm.

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for continued jury deliberations.  The jurors requested a break at 9:38am.  The Court brought the jury back into the box at 10:45am and advised the jury to continue to deliberate.  At the hour of 11:54am, the jury was brought back into the box.  The foreperson informed the Judge that they are deadlocked and there is no need for further deliberations.  The Court dismissed the jury at 12:10pm and declared a MISTRIAL.  The State indicated they would be retrying the case again.  The Court indicated that the speedy disposition detainer is done.  Matter is set for a Jury Trial on January 19, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.
Court reviews jury instructions with the parties.
2:33 p.m.  Jury in the box.   Exhibit # 21 offered by defense and received.
Defense rests.  
Court instructs the jury.
Closing statements by the State and defense counsel.
Alternate juror chosen.
At the hour of 3:37 p.m. the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Deputies  W. Adams and M. Gaudynski who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Question from the jury panel regarding the photos.  Jury panel was NOT brought back into court.  All photos received into evidence were delivered to the deliberation room - deliberations continued.
Further questions from the jury panel.  Jury panel was NOT brought back into court.  Court sent written replies to the deliberation room - deliberations continued.
4:54 p.m.  Jury in the box.  Deliberations suspended for the evening.  Case adjourned to 8:30 a.m. on 10-21-2015.
Jury released for the evening.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Molina, Milwaukee Police Department Investigator Jason Reifschneider, Milwaukee Police Department Latent Print Examiner David Wagoner, and DNA Analyst Patricia Dobrowski.  Exhibits #1, #2, #3, #4, #10, #11 and #20 received. Sworn for Defense:  Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Conway.  The Court held colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify. Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to testify.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 11:45am.  Matter is adjourned to October 20, 2015 at 2:00pm.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in court with Attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Hakeem Dontrail Harris in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Jury Trial.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:36am.   Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Scott Kaiser, Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Conway.  The Court has a side bar with counsels.  Exhibits #7, #8, #9, #13, #14 and #18 received.   Matter is adjourned at 4:44pm.  Matter is adjourned to 9:30am on October 20, 2015 in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
